verses.kjv: Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
verses.web: Give ear, you heavens, and I will speak. Let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
verses.ct: Listen, O heavens, as I speak! Let the earth hear the words from my mouth.

verses.kjv: My doctrine shall drop as the rain, my speech shall distil as the dew, as the small rain upon the tender herb, and as the showers upon the grass:
verses.web: My doctrine will drop as the rain. My speech will condense as the dew, as the misty rain on the tender grass, as the showers on the herb.
verses.ct: My teaching will fall like rain, and my words will settle like dew — like gentle showers on new grass, like steady rain on growing plants.

verses.kjv: Because I will publish the name of the LORD: ascribe ye greatness unto our God.
verses.web: For I will proclaim LORD’s name. Ascribe greatness to our God!
verses.ct: I will proclaim the name of the LORD. Declare the greatness of our God!

verses.kjv: He is the Rock, his work is perfect: for all his ways are judgment: a God of truth and without iniquity, just and right is he.
verses.web: The Rock: his work is perfect, for all his ways are just. A God of faithfulness who does no wrong, just and right is he.
verses.ct: He is the Rock — everything he does is perfect. All his ways are just. He is a faithful God who does no wrong; he is righteous and true.

verses.kjv: They have corrupted themselves, their spot is not the spot of his children: they are a perverse and crooked generation.
verses.web: They have dealt corruptly with him. They are not his children, because of their defect. They are a perverse and crooked generation.
verses.ct: But his people have become corrupt. Their flaws prove they are not his children. They are a twisted and crooked generation.

verses.kjv: Do ye thus requite the LORD, O foolish people and unwise? is not he thy father that hath bought thee? hath he not made thee, and established thee?
verses.web: Is this the way you repay LORD, foolish and unwise people? Isn’t he your father who has bought you? He has made you and established you.
verses.ct: Is this how you repay the LORD, you foolish and senseless people? Isn't he your Father, the one who made you? He created you and established you!

verses.kjv: Remember the days of old, consider the years of many generations: ask thy father, and he will shew thee; thy elders, and they will tell thee.
verses.web: Remember the days of old. Consider the years of many generations. Ask your father, and he will show you; your elders, and they will tell you.
verses.ct: Think back to the ancient days. Consider the years across many generations. Ask your father — he'll tell you. Ask your elders — they'll explain it to you.

verses.kjv: When the Most High divided to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the sons of Adam, he set the bounds of the people according to the number of the children of Israel.
verses.web: When the Most High gave to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the children of men, he set the bounds of the peoples according to the number of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: When the Most High divided the nations and gave them their lands, when he separated the peoples of the earth, he set the boundaries of every nation according to the number of the children of Israel.

verses.kjv: For the LORD’s portion is his people; Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
verses.web: For LORD’s portion is his people. Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
verses.ct: The LORD's own portion is his people. Jacob is his chosen inheritance.

verses.kjv: He found him in a desert land, and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about, he instructed him, he kept him as the apple of his eye.
verses.web: He found him in a desert land, in the waste howling wilderness. He surrounded him. He cared for him. He kept him as the apple of his eye.
verses.ct: He found him in a barren desert, in a desolate, wind-swept wasteland. He surrounded him and watched over him. He guarded him as the apple of his eye.

verses.kjv: As an eagle stirreth up her nest, fluttereth over her young, spreadeth abroad her wings, taketh them, beareth them on her wings:
verses.web: As an eagle that stirs up her nest, that flutters over her young, he spread abroad his wings, he took them, he bore them on his feathers.
verses.ct: Like an eagle that stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, he spread his wings and caught them, carrying them on his feathers.

verses.kjv: So the LORD alone did lead him, and there was no strange god with him.
verses.web: LORD alone led him. There was no foreign god with him.
verses.ct: The LORD alone led him. No foreign god was with him.

verses.kjv: He made him ride on the high places of the earth, that he might eat the increase of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of the rock, and oil out of the flinty rock;
verses.web: He made him ride on the high places of the earth. He ate the increase of the field. He caused him to suck honey out of the rock, oil out of the flinty rock;
verses.ct: He let him ride over the heights of the land and feast on the harvest of the fields. He gave him honey from the rock and oil from the flinty stone,

verses.kjv: Butter of kine, and milk of sheep, with fat of lambs, and rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, with the fat of kidneys of wheat; and thou didst drink the pure blood of the grape.
verses.web: butter from the herd, and milk from the flock, with fat of lambs, rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, with the finest of the wheat. From the blood of the grape, you drank wine.
verses.ct: butter from the herd and milk from the flock, along with the finest lambs, rams from Bashan, and goats, together with the richest wheat. And you drank wine — the pure blood of the grape.

verses.kjv: But Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: thou art waxen fat, thou art grown thick, thou art covered with fatness; then he forsook God which made him, and lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
verses.web: But Jeshurun grew fat, and kicked. You have grown fat. You have grown thick. You have become sleek. Then he abandoned God who made him, and rejected the Rock of his salvation.
verses.ct: But Jeshurun grew fat and rebellious. You grew fat, bloated, and sleek! Then he abandoned the God who made him and rejected the Rock of his salvation.

verses.kjv: They provoked him to jealousy with strange gods, with abominations provoked they him to anger.
verses.web: They moved him to jealousy with strange gods. They provoked him to anger with abominations.
verses.ct: They made him jealous with foreign gods and provoked him to anger with detestable practices.

verses.kjv: They sacrificed unto devils, not to God; to gods whom they knew not, to new gods that came newly up, whom your fathers feared not.
verses.web: They sacrificed to demons, not God, to gods that they didn’t know, to new gods that came up recently, which your fathers didn’t dread.
verses.ct: They sacrificed to demons, not to God — to gods they had never known, new gods that had recently appeared, gods your ancestors never feared.

verses.kjv: Of the Rock that begat thee thou art unmindful, and hast forgotten God that formed thee.
verses.web: Of the Rock who became your father, you are unmindful, and have forgotten God who gave you birth.
verses.ct: You forgot the Rock who fathered you. You abandoned the God who gave you life.

verses.kjv: And when the LORD saw it, he abhorred them, because of the provoking of his sons, and of his daughters.
verses.web: LORD saw and abhorred, because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
verses.ct: The LORD saw this and was filled with disgust, provoked by his own sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.
verses.web: He said, “I will hide my face from them. I will see what their end will be; for they are a very perverse generation, children in whom is no faithfulness.
verses.ct: He said, "I will hide my face from them and see what becomes of them. They are a twisted generation — children who have no faith."

verses.kjv: They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God; they have provoked me to anger with their vanities: and I will move them to jealousy with those which are not a people; I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
verses.web: They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God. They have provoked me to anger with their vanities. I will move them to jealousy with those who are not a people. I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
verses.ct: "They made me jealous with what is no god at all. They provoked me with their worthless idols. So I will make them jealous with a people who are no people. I will provoke them with a foolish nation."

verses.kjv: For a fire is kindled in mine anger, and shall burn unto the lowest hell, and shall consume the earth with her increase, and set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
verses.web: For a fire is kindled in my anger, that burns to the lowest Sheol, devours the earth with its increase, and sets the foundations of the mountains on fire.
verses.ct: "A fire has been kindled by my anger — it burns down to the depths of Sheol. It will devour the earth and its harvests and set the foundations of the mountains ablaze."

verses.kjv: I will heap mischiefs upon them; I will spend mine arrows upon them.
verses.web: “I will heap evils on them. I will spend my arrows on them.
verses.ct: "I will pile disaster upon them. I will spend every arrow I have against them."

verses.kjv: They shall be burnt with hunger, and devoured with burning heat, and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the poison of serpents of the dust.
verses.web: They shall be wasted with hunger, and devoured with burning heat and bitter destruction. I will send the teeth of animals on them, with the venom of vipers that glide in the dust.
verses.ct: "They will waste away from hunger, consumed by burning fever and deadly plague. I will send wild beasts to tear at them and venomous snakes to strike from the dust."

verses.kjv: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.
verses.web: Outside the sword will bereave, and in the rooms, terror on both young man and virgin, the nursing infant with the gray-haired man.
verses.ct: "In the streets, the sword will cut them down. In their homes, terror will grip them — young men and young women alike, nursing infants and the gray-haired old."

verses.kjv: I said, I would scatter them into corners, I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
verses.web: I said that I would scatter them afar. I would make their memory to cease from among men;
verses.ct: "I considered scattering them to the farthest corners of the earth, wiping out every memory of them among the nations."

verses.kjv: Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, and lest they should say, Our hand is high, and the LORD hath not done all this.
verses.web: were it not that I feared the provocation of the enemy, lest their adversaries should judge wrongly, lest they should say, ‘Our hand is exalted, LORD has not done all this.’ ”
verses.ct: "But I held back because of the enemy. I didn't want their adversaries to misunderstand and boast, 'Our own power did this — the LORD had nothing to do with it.'"

verses.kjv: For they are a nation void of counsel, neither is there any understanding in them.
verses.web: For they are a nation void of counsel. There is no understanding in them.
verses.ct: Israel is a nation without sense. There is no understanding in them.

verses.kjv: O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!
verses.web: Oh that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!
verses.ct: If only they were wise! If only they understood this and thought about where they would end up!

verses.kjv: How should one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their Rock had sold them, and the LORD had shut them up?
verses.web: How could one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, and LORD had delivered them up?
verses.ct: How could 1 man chase 1,000, or 2 put 10,000 to flight, unless their Rock had sold them out and the LORD had handed them over?

verses.kjv: For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges.
verses.web: For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves concede.
verses.ct: The rock of our enemies is nothing like our Rock — even our enemies admit that.

verses.kjv: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom, and of the fields of Gomorrah: their grapes are grapes of gall, their clusters are bitter:
verses.web: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom, of the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are poison grapes. Their clusters are bitter.
verses.ct: Their vine comes from the vine of Sodom, from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are poisonous, their clusters bitter.

verses.kjv: Their wine is the poison of dragons, and the cruel venom of asps.
verses.web: Their wine is the poison of serpents, the cruel venom of asps.
verses.ct: Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras.

verses.kjv: Is not this laid up in store with me, and sealed up among my treasures?
verses.web: “Isn’t this laid up in store with me, sealed up among my treasures?
verses.ct: "Isn't all of this stored up with me, sealed away in my treasuries?"

verses.kjv: To me belongeth vengeance, and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.
verses.web: Vengeance is mine, and recompense, at the time when their foot slides; for the day of their calamity is at hand. Their doom rushes at them.”
verses.ct: "Vengeance is mine, and I will repay. In due time their foot will slip, for the day of their disaster is near, and their doom is rushing toward them."

verses.kjv: For the LORD shall judge his people, and repent himself for his servants, when he seeth that their power is gone, and there is none shut up, or left.
verses.web: For LORD will judge his people, and have compassion on his servants, when he sees that their power is gone; that there is no one remaining, shut up or left at large.
verses.ct: The LORD will judge his people and have compassion on his servants when he sees that their strength is gone and no one is left — neither slave nor free.

verses.kjv: And he shall say, Where are their gods, their rock in whom they trusted,
verses.web: He will say, “Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge;
verses.ct: Then he will say, "Where are their gods now? Where is the rock they ran to for shelter?"

verses.kjv: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.
verses.web: which ate the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offering? Let them rise up and help you! Let them be your protection.
verses.ct: "Where are the gods who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their offerings? Let those gods rise up and help you! Let them be your protection!"

verses.kjv: See now that I, even I, am he, and there is no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: neither is there any that can deliver out of my hand.
verses.web: “See now that I myself am he. There is no god with me. I kill and I make alive. I wound and I heal. There is no one who can deliver out of my hand.
verses.ct: "Look and see — I alone am God. There is no god besides me. I bring death and I give life. I wound and I heal. No one can rescue anyone from my hand."

verses.kjv: For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.
verses.web: For I lift up my hand to heaven and declare, as I live forever,
verses.ct: "I raise my hand to heaven and declare: as surely as I live forever,"

verses.kjv: If I whet my glittering sword, and mine hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to mine enemies, and will reward them that hate me.
verses.web: if I sharpen my glittering sword, my hand grasps it in judgment; I will take vengeance on my adversaries, and will repay those who hate me.
verses.ct: "when I sharpen my flashing sword and my hand seizes it for judgment, I will take vengeance on my enemies and repay those who hate me."

verses.kjv: I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, and my sword shall devour flesh; and that with the blood of the slain and of the captives, from the beginning of revenges upon the enemy.
verses.web: I will make my arrows drunk with blood. My sword shall devour flesh with the blood of the slain and the captives, from the head of the leaders of the enemy.”
verses.ct: "I will make my arrows drunk with blood, and my sword will feast on flesh — the blood of the slain and the captives, from the heads of the enemy's leaders."

verses.kjv: Rejoice, O ye nations, with his people: for he will avenge the blood of his servants, and will render vengeance to his adversaries, and will be merciful unto his land, and to his people.
verses.web: Rejoice, you nations, with his people, for he will avenge the blood of his servants. He will take vengeance on his adversaries, and will make atonement for his land and for his people.
verses.ct: Rejoice with his people, O nations! For he will avenge the blood of his servants. He will take vengeance on his enemies and make atonement for his land and his people.

verses.kjv: And Moses came and spake all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he, and Hoshea the son of Nun.
verses.web: Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.ct: Moses came with Hoshea son of Nun and spoke every word of this song so all the people could hear it.

verses.kjv: And Moses made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel:
verses.web: Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel.
verses.ct: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify among you this day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.
verses.web: He said to them, “Set your heart to all the words which I testify to you today, which you shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.
verses.ct: he told them, "Take to heart every word I have spoken to you today. Command your children to carefully obey every word of this law.

verses.kjv: For it is not a vain thing for you; because it is your life: and through this thing ye shall prolong your days in the land, whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
verses.web: For it is no vain thing for you, because it is your life, and through this thing you shall prolong your days in the land, where you go over the Jordan to possess it.”
verses.ct: "These are not empty words — they are your very life. By obeying them, you will live long in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses that selfsame day, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses that same day, saying,
verses.ct: That same day, the LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Get thee up into this mountain Abarim, unto mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho; and behold the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel for a possession:
verses.web: “Go up into this mountain of Abarim, to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is across from Jericho; and see the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel for a possession.
verses.ct: "Go up into the Abarim mountains, to Mount Nebo in the land of Moab, across from Jericho. Look out over the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the people of Israel as their possession.

verses.kjv: And die in the mount whither thou goest up, and be gathered unto thy people; as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor, and was gathered unto his people:
verses.web: Die on the mountain where you go up, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor, and was gathered to his people;
verses.ct: "There on the mountain you will die and join your ancestors, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and joined his ancestors."

verses.kjv: Because ye trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of MeribahKadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because ye sanctified me not in the midst of the children of Israel.
verses.web: because you trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah of Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because you didn’t uphold my holiness among the children of Israel.
verses.ct: "This is because both of you broke faith with me in front of the Israelites at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin. You did not uphold my holiness among the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: Yet thou shalt see the land before thee; but thou shalt not go thither unto the land which I give the children of Israel.
verses.web: For you shall see the land from a distance; but you shall not go there into the land which I give the children of Israel.”
verses.ct: "You will see the land from a distance, but you will not enter it — this land that I am giving to the people of Israel."
